
An intern encrypted the plans using RSA, but chose both primes as Blum integers for "extra security." Recover the message: 9230619729119519822839764292480593560512944583995067281519136530234847353011091978729961034294045049882972602251580275244792428499798824993493318714859660

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{gdd2b0mt}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 9230619729119519822839764292480593560512944583995067281519136530234847353011091978729961034294045049882972602251580275244792428499798824993493318714859660
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=10074510460226996654698510186745348524266175526665698651715807480905404152998997925144505511807492809031659308925668878191873179016620827180737017279197973, e=7559821951807148393804422458895781774723230379884853564629778098604480575889259342225983372416877149753451371319464727041699512676017714481154850189493885
